data.title: Saving Private Ryan (1998)
data.summary: Following the Normandy Landings, a group of U.S. soldiers go behind enemy lines to retrieve a paratrooper whose brothers have been killed in action.

data.title: La vita è bella (1997)
data.summary: When an open-minded Jewish librarian and his son become victims of the Holocaust, he uses a perfect mixture of will, humor, and imagination to protect his son from the dangers around their camp.

data.title: Apocalypse Now (1979)
data.summary: During the Vietnam War, Captain Willard is sent on a dangerous mission into Cambodia to assassinate a renegade Colonel who has set himself up as a god among a local tribe.

data.title: The Pianist (2002)
data.summary: A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II.

data.title: Casablanca (1942)
data.summary: A cynical nightclub owner protects an old flame and her husband from Nazis in Morocco.

data.title: Braveheart (1995)
data.summary: When his secret bride is executed for assaulting an English soldier who tried to rape her, Sir William Wallace begins a revolt against King Edward I of England.

data.title: Das Boot (1981)
data.summary: The claustrophobic world of a WWII German U-boat; boredom, filth and sheer terror.

data.title: Inglourious Basterds (2009)
data.summary: In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a plan to assassinate Nazi leaders by a group of Jewish U.S. soldiers coincides with a theatre owner's vengeful plans for the same.

data.title: Full Metal Jacket (1987)
data.summary: A pragmatic U.S. Marine observes the dehumanizing effects the Vietnam War has on his fellow recruits from their brutal boot camp training to the bloody street fighting in Hue.

data.title: Lawrence of Arabia (1962)
data.summary: The story of T.E. Lawrence, the English officer who successfully united and led the diverse, often warring, Arab tribes during World War I in order to fight the Turks.

data.title: Pan's Labyrinth (2006)
data.summary: In the falangist Spain of 1944, the bookish young stepdaughter of a sadistic army officer escapes into an eerie but captivating fantasy world.

data.title: Gone with the Wind (1939)
data.summary: A manipulative woman and a roguish man conduct a turbulent romance during the American Civil War and Reconstruction periods.

data.title: Der Untergang (2004)
data.summary: Traudl Junge, the final secretary for Adolf Hitler, tells of the Nazi dictator's final days in his Berlin bunker at the end of WWII.

data.title: Incendies (2010)
data.summary: Twins journey to the Middle East to discover their family history and fulfill their mother's last wishes.

data.title: The Great Escape (1963)
data.summary: Allied prisoners of war plan for several hundred of their number to escape from a German camp during World War II.

data.title: Idi i smotri (1985)
data.summary: After finding an old rifle, a young boy joins the Soviet resistance movement against ruthless German forces and experiences the horrors of World War II.

data.title: Hacksaw Ridge (2016)
data.summary: World War II American Army Medic Desmond T. Doss, who served during the Battle of Okinawa, refuses to kill people, and becomes the first man in American history to receive the Medal of Honor without firing a shot.

data.title: The Deer Hunter (1978)
data.summary: An in-depth examination of the ways in which the U.S. Vietnam War impacts and disrupts the lives of people in a small industrial town in Pennsylvania.

data.title: Platoon (1986)
data.summary: A young soldier in Vietnam faces a moral crisis when confronted with the horrors of war and the duality of man.

data.title: Barry Lyndon (1975)
data.summary: An Irish rogue wins the heart of a rich widow and assumes her dead husband's aristocratic position in 18th-century England.

data.title: Dunkirk (2017)
data.summary: Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Empire and France are surrounded by the German Army, and evacuated during a fierce battle in World War II.

data.title: The Imitation Game (2014)
data.summary: During World War II, the English mathematical genius Alan Turing tries to crack the German Enigma code with help from fellow mathematicians.

data.title: Doctor Zhivago (1965)
data.summary: The life of a Russian physician and poet who, although married to another, falls in love with a political activist's wife and experiences hardship during the First World War and then the October Revolution.

data.title: To Have and Have Not (1944)
data.summary: During World War II, American expatriate Harry Morgan helps transport a French Resistance leader and his beautiful wife to Martinique while romancing a sensuous lounge singer.

data.title: Patton (1970)
data.summary: The World War II phase of the career of the controversial American general, George S. Patton.

data.title: Spartacus (1960)
data.summary: The slave Spartacus leads a violent revolt against the decadent Roman Republic.

data.title: The African Queen (1951)
data.summary: In Africa during World War I, a gin-swilling riverboat captain is persuaded by a strait-laced missionary to use his boat to attack an enemy warship.

data.title: Atonement (2007)
data.summary: Fledgling writer Briony Tallis, as a thirteen-year-old, irrevocably changes the course of several lives when she accuses her older sister's lover of a crime he did not commit.

data.title: The Last of the Mohicans (1992)
data.summary: Three trappers protect a British Colonel's daughters in the midst of the French and Indian War.

data.title: Empire of the Sun (1987)
data.summary: A young English boy struggles to survive under Japanese occupation during World War II.

data.title: The Boy in the Striped Pyjamas (2008)
data.summary: Set during WWII, a story seen through the innocent eyes of Bruno, the eight-year-old son of the commandant at a German concentration camp, whose forbidden friendship with a Jewish boy on the other side of the camp fence has startling and unexpected consequences.

data.title: Beasts of No Nation (2015)
data.summary: A drama based on the experiences of Agu, a child soldier fighting in the civil war of an unnamed African country.

data.title: Black Hawk Down (2001)
data.summary: 160 elite U.S. soldiers drop into Somalia to capture two top lieutenants of a renegade warlord and find themselves in a desperate battle with a large force of heavily-armed Somalis.

data.title: The Last Samurai (2003)
data.summary: An American military advisor embraces the Samurai culture he was hired to destroy after he is captured in battle.

data.title: Fury (2014)
data.summary: A grizzled tank commander makes tough decisions as he and his crew fight their way across Germany in April, 1945.

data.title: Les Misérables (2012)
data.summary: In 19th-century France, Jean Valjean, who for decades has been hunted by the ruthless policeman Javert after breaking parole, agrees to care for a factory worker's daughter. The decision changes their lives forever.

data.title: The Hurt Locker (2008)
data.summary: During the Iraq War, a Sergeant recently assigned to an army bomb squad is put at odds with his squad mates due to his maverick way of handling his work.

data.title: The Thin Red Line (1998)
data.summary: Adaptation of James Jones' autobiographical 1962 novel, focusing on the conflict at Guadalcanal during the second World War.

data.title: MASH (1970)
data.summary: The staff of a Korean War field hospital use humor and high jinks to keep their sanity in the face of the horror of war.

data.title: Enemy at the Gates (2001)
data.summary: A Russian and a German sniper play a game of cat-and-mouse during the Battle of Stalingrad.

data.title: Wonder Woman (2017)
data.summary: When a pilot crashes and tells of conflict in the outside world, Diana, an Amazonian warrior in training, leaves home to fight a war, discovering her full powers and true destiny.

data.title: Lone Survivor (2013)
data.summary: Marcus Luttrell and his team set out on a mission to capture or kill notorious Taliban leader Ahmad Shah, in late June 2005. Marcus and his team are left to fight for their lives in one of the most valiant efforts of modern warfare.

data.title: Der Hauptmann (2017)
data.summary: In the last moments of World War II, a young German soldier fighting for survival finds a Nazi captain's uniform. Impersonating an officer, the man quickly takes on the monstrous identity of the perpetrators he is trying to escape from.

data.title: Legends of the Fall (1994)
data.summary: In the early 1900s, three brothers and their father living in the remote wilderness of Montana are affected by betrayal, history, love, nature, and war.

data.title: Darkest Hour (2017)
data.summary: In May 1940, the fate of Western Europe hangs on British Prime Minister Winston Churchill, who must decide whether to negotiate with Adolf Hitler, or fight on knowing that it could mean a humiliating defeat for Britain and its empire.

data.title: Lincoln (2012)
data.summary: As the American Civil War continues to rage, America's president struggles with continuing carnage on the battlefield as he fights with many inside his own cabinet on the decision to emancipate the slaves.

data.title: Mudbound (2017)
data.summary: Two men return home from World War II to work on a farm in rural Mississippi, where they struggle to deal with racism and adjusting to life after war.

data.title: The English Patient (1996)
data.summary: At the close of WWII, a young nurse tends to a badly-burned plane crash victim. His past is shown in flashbacks, revealing an involvement in a fateful love affair.

data.title: A Bridge Too Far (1977)
data.summary: Operation Market Garden, September 1944: The Allies attempt to capture several strategically important bridges in the Netherlands in the hope of breaking the German lines. However, mismanagement and poor planning result in its failure.

data.title: Den 12. mann (2017)
data.summary: They were 12 saboteurs. The Nazis killed 11 of them. This is the true story of the one who got away...

data.title: 13 Hours (2016)
data.summary: During an attack on a U.S. compound in Libya, a security team struggles to make sense out of the chaos.

data.title: American Sniper (2014)
data.summary: Navy S.E.A.L. sniper Chris Kyle's pinpoint accuracy saves countless lives on the battlefield and turns him into a legend. Back home to his wife and kids after four tours of duty, however, Chris finds that it is the war he can't leave behind.

data.title: Eye in the Sky (2015)
data.summary: Col. Katherine Powell, a military officer in command of an operation to capture terrorists in Kenya, sees her mission escalate when a girl enters the kill zone triggering an international dispute over the implications of modern warfare.

data.title: Rescue Dawn (2006)
data.summary: A U.S. fighter pilot's epic struggle of survival after being shot down on a mission over Laos during the Vietnam War.

data.title: Crimson Tide (1995)
data.summary: On a U.S. nuclear missile sub, a young First Officer stages a mutiny, to prevent his trigger happy Captain from launching his missiles, before confirming his orders to do so.

data.title: Unbroken (I) (2014)
data.summary: After a near-fatal plane crash in WWII, Olympian Louis Zamperini spends a harrowing 47 days in a raft with two fellow crewmen before he's caught by the Japanese navy and sent to a prisoner-of-war camp.

data.title: The Death of Stalin (2017)
data.summary: Follows the Soviet dictator's last days and depicts the chaos of the regime after his death.

data.title: Kingdom of Heaven (2005)
data.summary: Balian of Ibelin travels to Jerusalem during the Crusades of the 12th century, and there he finds himself as the defender of the city and its people.

data.title: The Patriot (2000)
data.summary: Peaceful farmer Benjamin Martin is driven to lead the Colonial Militia during the American Revolution when a sadistic British officer murders his son.

data.title: War Horse (2011)
data.summary: Young Albert enlists to serve in World War I after his beloved horse is sold to the cavalry. Albert's hopeful journey takes him out of England and to the front lines as the war rages on.

data.title: We Were Soldiers (2002)
data.summary: The story of the first major battle of the American phase of the Vietnam War, and the soldiers on both sides that fought it, while their wives wait nervously and anxiously at home for the good news or the bad news.

data.title: Cold Mountain (2003)
data.summary: In the waning days of the American Civil War, a wounded soldier embarks on a perilous journey back home to Cold Mountain, North Carolina to reunite with his sweetheart.

data.title: Allied (2016)
data.summary: In 1942, a Canadian intelligence officer in North Africa encounters a female French Resistance fighter on a deadly mission behind enemy lines. When they reunite in London, their relationship is tested by the pressures of war.

data.title: Body of Lies (2008)
data.summary: A CIA agent on the ground in Jordan hunts down a powerful terrorist leader while being caught between the unclear intentions of his American supervisors and Jordan Intelligence.

data.title: War Dogs (2016)
data.summary: Loosely based on the true story of two young men, David Packouz and Efraim Diveroli, who won a three hundred million dollar contract from the Pentagon to arm America's allies in Afghanistan.

data.title: Valkyrie (2008)
data.summary: A dramatization of the 20 July assassination and political coup plot by desperate renegade German Army officers against Hitler during World War II.

data.title: Brothers (I) (2009)
data.summary: A young man comforts his older brother's wife and children after he goes missing in Afghanistan.

data.title: Rambo (2008)
data.summary: In Thailand, John Rambo joins a group of mercenaries to venture into war-torn Burma, and rescue a group of Christian aid workers who were kidnapped by the ruthless local infantry unit.

data.title: Suite Française (2014)
data.summary: During the early years of Nazi occupation of France in World War II, romance blooms between Lucile Angellier (Michelle Williams), a French villager, and Bruno von Falk (Matthias Schoenaerts), a German soldier.

data.title: Jarhead (2005)
data.summary: A psychological study of operations desert shield and desert storm during the gulf war; through the eyes of a U.S marine sniper who struggles to cope with the possibility his girlfriend may be cheating on him back home.

data.title: Stripes (1981)
data.summary: Two friends who are dissatisfied with their jobs decide to join the army for a bit of fun.

data.title: Last Flag Flying (2017)
data.summary: Thirty years after they served together in Vietnam, a former Navy Corpsman Larry "Doc" Shepherd re-unites with his old buddies, former Marines Sal Nealon and Reverend Richard Mueller, to bury his son, a young Marine killed in the Iraq War.

data.title: 12 Strong (2018)
data.summary: 12 Strong tells the story of the first Special Forces team deployed to Afghanistan after 9/11; under the leadership of a new captain, the team must work with an Afghan warlord to take down the Taliban.

data.title: Paltan (2018)
data.summary: Film based on 1962 India-China war known as Indo-Sino war.

data.title: Operation Crossbow (1965)
data.summary: Allied agents attempt to infiltrate the Nazis' rocket research site.

data.title: The Sum of All Fears (2002)
data.summary: CIA analyst Jack Ryan must stop the plans of a Neo Nazis faction that threatens to induce a catastrophic conflict between the United States and Russia's newly elected president by detonating a nuclear weapon at a football game in Baltimore.

data.title: HHhH (2017)
data.summary: As the German Fascists expand their borders, scorching Europe from end to end, two brave Czechs of the Resistance prepare for a suicide mission to assassinate Reinhard Heydrich, the hideous mastermind behind the "Final Solution".

data.title: Rambo: First Blood Part II (1985)
data.summary: John Rambo is released from prison by the government for a top-secret covert mission to the last place on Earth he'd want to return - the jungles of Vietnam.

data.title: Dracula Untold (2014)
data.summary: As his kingdom is being threatened by the Turks, young prince Vlad Tepes must become a monster feared by his own people in order to obtain the power needed to protect his own family, and the families of his kingdom.

data.title: King Arthur (2004)
data.summary: A demystified take on the tale of King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table.

data.title: Sand Castle (2017)
data.summary: The story follows a young soldier, and his introduction into the 2003 invasion of Iraq. Based on true events, it bears witness to the destruction, and horrors of war.

data.title: Dear John (I) (2010)
data.summary: A romantic drama about a soldier who falls for a conservative college student while he's home on leave.

data.title: 300: Rise of an Empire (2014)
data.summary: Greek general Themistokles leads the charge against invading Persian forces led by mortal-turned-god Xerxes and Artemisia, vengeful commander of the Persian navy.

data.title: Pearl Harbor (2001)
data.summary: A tale of war and romance mixed in with history. The story follows two lifelong friends and a beautiful nurse who are caught up in the horror of an infamous Sunday morning in 1941.

data.title: The Monuments Men (2014)
data.summary: An unlikely World War II platoon is tasked to rescue art masterpieces from Nazi thieves and return them to their owners.

data.title: Hurricane (II) (2018)
data.summary: Hurricane (Squadron 303) is the story of a group of brave Poles who fought in the skies over England in WW2, not just to keep Great Britain free from the Nazis, but also to keep alive the ...                See full summary »

data.title: Salò o le 120 giornate di Sodoma (1975)
data.summary: In World War II Italy, four fascist libertines round up nine adolescent boys and girls and subject them to one hundred and twenty days of physical, mental and sexual torture.

data.title: War Machine (2017)
data.summary: An idiosyncratic general confronts opposition from enemies, allies, and bureaucrats while leading a massive rebuild operation in Afghanistan.

data.title: The Catcher Was a Spy (2018)
data.summary: A major league baseball player, Moe Berg, lives a double life working for the Office of Strategic Services.

data.title: Where Hands Touch (2018)
data.summary: A rites of passage story of a bi-racial teen struggling for survival in Nazi Germany.

data.title: The Yellow Birds (2017)
data.summary: Two young soldiers, Bartle (21) and Murph (18) navigate the terrors of the Iraq war under the command of the older, troubled Sergeant Sterling. All the while, Bartle is tortured by a promise he made to Murph's mother before their deployment.

data.title: Alexander (2004)
data.summary: Alexander, the King of Macedonia and one of the greatest army leaders in the history of warfare, conquers much of the known world.

data.title: Trench 11 (2017)
data.summary: In the final days of WWI, an allied army unit led by a shell-shocked soldier is sent to investigate a mysterious abandoned German facility located deep underground. What they find is fate worse than death.

data.title: Overlord (2018)
data.summary: The story of two American soldiers behind enemy lines on D Day.

data.title: Air Strike (2018)
data.summary: During World War II, five different Chinese people fight their way through Japanese Air Force attacks to protect an important military machine in Chongqing, 1940.

data.title: A Private War (2018)
data.summary: One of the most celebrated war correspondents of our time, Marie Colvin is an utterly fearless and rebellious spirit, driven to the frontline of conflicts across the globe to give voice to the voiceless.

data.title: Indivisible (II) (2018)
data.summary: INDIVISIBLE is the extraordinary true story of Army Chaplain Darren Turner and his wife Heather. When war etches battle scars on their hearts, they face one more battle: the fight to save their marriage. One marriage, one family, under God.

data.title: The Last Full Measure (2018)
data.summary: 34 years after his death, Airman William H. Pitsenbarger Jr. ("Pits") is awarded the nation's highest military honor, for his actions on the battlefield.
